intro: Megalastrum lunense, commonly known as the moonflower of the Andes, is a striking plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a sweet fragrance, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has dark green, velvety leaves and thrives in cool, humid environments. Its botanical features include a woody stem and a complex root system adapted to rocky soils. Megalastrum lunense is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its ecological significance in its native habitat.
